members.member:
A fixed-point number. 16 lower bits are used for the decimal part, 48 for the integral part.
It provides various methods for performing mathematical operations and converting between different data types.
However, a majority of internal code and the multiplication operator perform fast multiplication, where the result can use at most 32 bits for the integral part and overflows are not detected. This means that you should stay in range.
\ingroup MathAPI
The precision of the decimal part is 5 digits. The decimal fraction normalizer is 1E5. The size of an FP object is 8 bytes. The raw value of one is equal to FPLut.ONE. The raw value of zero is 0. The precision value is equal to FPLut.PRECISION. The number of bits in an FP object is equal to the size of a long (64 bits). The MulRound constant is 0. The MulShift constant is equal to the precision value. The MulShiftTrunc constant is equal to the precision value. The UsesRoundedConstants constant is either or , depending on the value of PHOTONDETERMINISTIC_FP_OLD_CONSTANTS.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FP.SIZE
member.summary:
Represents the size of a variable in bytes.
The SIZE constant is used to determine the size of a variable in bytes.

member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.FP.Comparer
member.summary: Compares s.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FP.Comparer.Instance
member.summary: A global FP comparer instance.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.FP.Comparer.Compare(Photon.Deterministic.FP,Photon.Deterministic.FP)
member.summary: Compares two instances of FP and returns an integer that indicates whether the first instance is less than, equal to, or greater than the second instance.
member.returns: A signed integer that indicates the relative values of x and y, as shown in the following table: - Less than zero: x is less than y. - Zero: x equals y. - Greater than zero: x is greater than y.

member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.FPLut
member.summary: The lookup table for the inverse cosine function. The table stores precalculated values of the inverse cosine function for specific angles. The values are in fixed-point format with a precision of 16 bits.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FPLut.PRECISION
member.summary: The number of bits used for the fractional part of the fixed-point numbers.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FPLut.PI
member.summary: The value of PI in fixed-point format.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FPLut.PITIMES2
member.summary: The value of PI times 2 in fixed-point format.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FPLut.PIOVER2
member.summary: The value of PI divided by 2 in fixed-point format.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FPLut.ONE
member.summary: The value of one in fixed-point format.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.FPLut.Log2APShiftForHPDivision
member.summary: How much Log2 additional precision (AP) result needs to be shifted to allow for a safe FPHighPrecision division. There must be a way to calculate this, but I have a brain fog atm. 6 is the safe choice here - max log2 is 48.

member.summary: Lookup table for the Atan function in FPMath

member.summary: Lookup table for the tangent function.

member.summary: Lookup table for the log2 function.

member.summary: Matrix with 0s in every cell.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of the current FPMatrix2x2 object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current FPMatrix2x2 object. The string is formatted as "(({0}, {1}), ({2}, {3}))" where {0} represents the value of M00, {1} represents the value of M01, {2} represents the value of M10, and {3} represents the value of M11. The values are formatted using the InvariantCulture.

Returns the dot product between two rotations. This method computes the equivalent to the following pseduo-code:
return a.X * b.X + a.Y * b.Y + a.Z * b.Z + a.W * b.W;

member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.Plane
member.summary: Represents a plane in three-dimensional space.
member.remarks: A plane is defined by an origin point and a normal vector, which is perpendicular to the plane. The equation of the plane is represented as a mathematical equation: Ax + By + Cz + D = 0, where A, B, C, and D are coefficients that define the plane.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.equation0
member.summary: Represents the coefficient for a plane.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.equation1
member.summary: Represents the coefficient for a plane.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.equation2
member.summary: Represents the coefficient for a plane.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.equation3
member.summary: Represents the equation coefficient for a plane.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.origin
member.summary: Represents the origin point of a plane in three-dimensional space.
member.remarks: The origin point is the starting point or reference point for the plane. It is used to define the position of the plane in space.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.normal
member.summary: Represents a normal vector in three-dimensional space.
member.remarks: A normal vector is a vector that is perpendicular to a plane. In the context of the Plane struct, the normal vector represents the direction that the plane faces.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.#ctor(Photon.Deterministic.FPVector3,Photon.Deterministic.FPVector3)
member.summary: Represents a plane in three-dimensional space defined by an origin point and a normal vector.
member.remarks: A plane is typically defined by a point on the plane and a normal vector perpendicular to the plane. The equation of the plane is given by: equation0 * x + equation1 * y + equation2 * z + equation3 = 0

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.Plane.#ctor(Photon.Deterministic.FPVector3,Photon.Deterministic.FPVector3,Photon.Deterministic.FPVector3)
member.summary: Creates a plane in three-dimensional space.

member.summary: Determines whether the plane is front-facing to a given direction.
member.param: The direction to compare the plane's normal vector to.
member.returns: if the plane is front-facing to the direction, otherwise.

member.summary: Returns the signed distance from a point to the plane.
member.param: The point from which to calculate the distance.
member.returns: The signed distance from the point to the plane.

member.summary: Serializes a IntVector3 to a stream using an IDeterministicFrameSerializer. member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicPlayerMap
member.summary: A utility class to collect a list of players and player slots. A client can maintain multiple players with individual player slots. The player always refers to a global player index that is the same on all clients. The player slot is a zero based index counting the number of players that one client controls. E.g. a client has two players: PlayerRef 5 and PlayerRef 2, the player slots are 0 and 1.

member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession
member.summary: Represents a Quantum runtime match, holding the references to Game, its Frames (game state) and Simulator, and implements (together with Simulator) the predict/rollback logic, time control and input management. Single use, so whenever a Session is shutdown (or disconnected), it can't be reused anymore and a new one must be instantiated.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.MaxVerifiedTicksPerUpdate
member.summary: Limit the maximum number of verified ticks computed per update. Default is int.MaxValue.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.SpectatingOffsetSec
member.summary: Specify the offset in sec that the simulation will run behind in Spectator mode. Value must be negative or 0. Default is -1 sec.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.RuntimeConfig
member.summary: Serialized local copy of the game/session custom RuntimeConfig instance (received from the photon server). Since this has been received from server, it's the same in all instances.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.Stats
member.summary: Copy of local runtime stats (stores the last Update values for simulation time, number of frames simulated, etc). Used by the QuantumStatsUI to show these in runtime on Unity.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.Game
member.summary: The matching game instance, which holds the Frames (game state) and other accessory logic entry points for a predict/rollback match.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.FramePredicted
member.summary: Quick accessor to the latest locally predicted copy of the game state.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.FramePredictedPrevious
member.summary: Quick accessor to the second latest locally predicted copy of the game state. Used for accurate visual interpolation of transforms (or any other data) between this and the Predicted frame.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.FrameVerified
member.summary: Quick accessor to the forward-only verified data (simulated with confirmed inputs from server in online games). Can be used as source of truth, as this does not include predicted data.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.PreviousUpdateFramePredicted
member.summary: Quick accessor to the latest simulated copy of the Frame that was last-Predicted during the previous main session update. Used to calculate transform view error for smoothed correction.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.SessionConfig
member.summary: Local copy of the server-provided main set of settings, controlling update rate, input adjustment and other important control values. Since this has been received from server, it's the same set of values in all instances.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.AccumulatedTime
member.summary: Remaining accumulated time after all frames forward (both verified and predicted) have been simulated. Usually less than a full delta-time (defined by update rate), and used to compute the interpolation alpha. Can be above delta-time if the current session is temporarily lagging behind and can not simulate forward the full prediction (depending on settings).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.InitialTick
member.summary: Normally zero (0) for most game clients. Can be set to a specific value if a local copy for initial frame snapshot data is provided (normally used occasionally in case of quick rejoinining a room).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IntitialFrameData
member.summary: Serialized local copy for initial frame snapshot data, if provided when starting a new session (normally used occasionally in case of quick rejoinining a room).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.TimeScale
member.summary: Current time-dilation delta-time scale. Tf time-dilation settings allow it, server will reduce this to slow down games when some clients have very high ping (reducing the number of predictions).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.LocalPlayers
member.summary: The collection of PlayerRefs the local client has control of (sends input for).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.LocalPlayerSlots
member.summary: The collection of local-indexed (0-n) players the local client has control of (sends input for).

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsPlayerLocal(Quantum.PlayerRef)
member.summary:
Tests whereas this PlayerRef is controlled by this local client/session.
Caveat: This method will behave differently in replays, read the replay online documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.GetActorNumber
member.summary: Returns the Photon Actor Number of the connection, if in online mode. Otherwise, returns 0.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.TryGetLocalPlayer(System.Int32,Quantum.PlayerRef@)
member.summary:
Returns and fills in the corresponding global PlayerRef if playerSlot is a valid local slot, for which the session can send input.
Caveat: This method will behave differently in replays, read the replay online documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsPlayerSlotLocal(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Checks if this local player slot is currently in use (local slots can be added/removed dynamically).
Caveat: This method will behave differently in replays, read the replay online documentation for more information.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.PlayerCount
member.summary: Total/max number of PlayerRefs this particular session instance comprises of. This is not the number of connected players, but rather the total number.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.SimulationRate
member.summary: Fixed rate at which the game is simulated (verified frames). Can be set at DeterministicConfig.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.RollbackWindow
member.summary: Max number of frames/ticks the session is allowed to predict. Can be set at DeterministicConfig.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.LocalInputOffset
member.summary: Current value for the dynamically-adjusted input delay (independent for each client). Starts at the initial offset on DeterministicConfig (defaults to 0), and grows with RTT.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.PredictedFrames
member.summary: Stats: Number of predicted frames simulated during the last call to Update().

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.SimulationTimeElapsed
member.summary: Stats: Precise time in seconds used by the last call to Update(). Includes all session internal input handling, rollbacks, verified and predicted frames simulation.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.DeltaTime
member.summary: Fixed-point delta-time as defined by DeterministicConfig's UpdateFPS (1/UpdateFPS).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.DeltaTimeDouble
member.summary: Double version of delta-time as defined by DeterministicConfig's UpdateFPS (1/UpdateFPS).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.GameMode
member.summary: Possible modes are online/multiplayer, local or replay.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsLocal
member.summary: for replays and local games (single player or split screen/couch-local). for online games.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsOnline
member.summary: for online games. for replays and local games (single player or split screen/couch-local).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsSpectating
member.summary: Always once session is started. if at least one player is controlled by the local session.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsStalling
member.summary: if simulation is being clamped at max prediction (rollback window). Happens normally when input confirmations from server are disrupted (network loss or very high ping times).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsPaused
member.summary: Temporarily only for a session that has just been started (Start message arrived from server) while waiting for a snapshot to arrive.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsLockstep
member.summary: Legacy mode in which frames are only simulated forward with input delay, and no prediction is ever performed. In the past this was the default approach for classic RTS games.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsPredicted
member.summary: when not using legacy lockstep mode. Means frames will be predicted and rolled back.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsReplay
member.summary: when GameMode is Replay (input comes from replay provider).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsInterpolatable
member.summary: If the session provides previous states for interpolation.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsReplayFinished
member.summary: when the final input in the replay stream has been consumed to simulate forward a verified frame.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.HasStarted
member.summary: The initial state is idle, then it will be started after confirmation from the server.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsRunning
member.summary: if local session is started and active.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsDestroyed
member.summary: Returns when has been called.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.ReplayProvider
member.summary: When running replays, input comes from the provider/container. Replay input streams can com from file, memory, or a network stream (custom).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.PlatformInfo
member.summary: Cached info about the local device platform (some OS and hardware available specs).

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.CommandSerializer
member.summary: Local instance of specialized serializer that can pack/unpack DeterministicCommands to/from byte[]s.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.Runner
member.summary: Runner is the wrapper for session/game that can be attached to Unity, a .Net console app, or a Quantum Custom Server Plugin.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.OnDestroyed
member.summary: Is executed in the end of . Is used by the server simulation.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.InputPool
member.summary: Accessor to the pool of input objects.

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.AllPlayers
member.summary:
Create lazily a list of all possible player slots. Used for polling in Replay and Local mode.
Caveat: During DeterministicSession constructor in Local mode PlayerCount is not set, yet.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.#ctor(Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionArgs)
member.summary: Validates a few conditions to assert the session object has coherent settings. After construction, session is ready to Join/Start a game.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.GetLocalConfigs(Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Retrieves the local copies of the main configs.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsFrameVerified(System.Int32)
member.summary: if the latest confirmed/verified frame is equals or larger then this.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.IsLocalPlayer(Quantum.PlayerRef)
member.summary: if this global PlayerRef is controlled by the local session.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.SendCommand(System.Int32,Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicCommand)
member.summary: Includes command for local prediction, and sends to server (in online games) for confirmation. Fails if this slot is not in use by the local session/client. Server protects against all forms of spoofing in online games.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.SetPlayerData(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Previously could be called multiple times to send custom data relative to a player. AddPlayer replaces it, and can only be called once for a specific slot.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.AddPlayer(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Attempts to add a local player slot to have input controlled by the session. Fails is local slot is already used, or if the server/plugin does not have an available PlayerRef.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.RemovePlayer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to remove a local player slot from the session. Fails is local slot is not currently in use.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.SendGameResult(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Supports sending one game result during one session per client. Send this based on timing and simulation data of a verified frame to make results be comparable. Data can be any format but the size must be below . Zip compress Json for example to reduce the size.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.Join(System.String)
member.summary: Sends the Join protocol message to server/plugin. If successful, a start protocol message (and optionally a snapshot) will be received and the session will start to be updated. Sessions are always joined as spectators (starting on Quantum 3.0), and adding local players that can have input polled for is a dynamic operation done after session start.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.ApplyTimeOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Legacy method to manually add time to the internal Simulator. Not used anymore by the standard SDK, but available to legacy projects.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.Destroy
member.summary: Terminates the game/session, Disposing all buffers and objects.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.Update(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Called to move the simulation forward (poll local input, decode confirmed, simulate verified and predicted frames). When passing a delta time, the internal Stopwatch is ignored.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSession.ResetReplay(Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicFrame)
member.summary: Resets the session to the specified frame for replay purposes.
member.param: The frame to reset the session to.

member.summary: Resynchronizes the session to the specified frame.

member.summary: Resynchronizes the session based on the provided frame data and frame number.
member.param: The frame data to use for resynchronization.
The frame number to resynchronize with.

member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicFrameSerializeMode
member.summary: The serialization mode used for serializing a DeterministicFrame.

member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig
member.summary: Parameterize internals of the Deterministic simulation and plugin (the Quantum server component).
member.para: This config file will be synchronized between all clients of one session. Though each player starts its own simulation locally with his own version of the DeterministicConfig the server will distribute the config file instance of the first player that joined the plugin.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.PlayerCount
member.summary: Player count the simulation is initialized for.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.ChecksumCrossPlatformDeterminism
member.summary: This allows Quantum frame checksumming to be deterministic across different runtime platforms, however it comes with quite a cost and should only be used during debugging.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.LockstepSimulation
member.summary: Legacy feature that forces the Quantum simulation to run in strict lockstep mode, where no rollbacks are performed. Most games suitable for lockstep are better off using a soft lockstep instead by introducing enough Min Input Offset (recommended at least 10 ticks), while still being able to perform predictions if and when necessary.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputDeltaCompression
member.summary: If the server should delta-compress inputs against previous tick-input-set (new/experimental).

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.UpdateFPS
member.summary: How many ticks per second Quantum should execute.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.ChecksumInterval
member.summary: How often we should send checksums of the frame state to the server for verification (useful during development, set to zero for release). Defined in frames.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.RollbackWindow
member.summary: How many frames are kept in the local ring buffer on each client. Controls how much Quantum can predict into the future. Not used in lockstep mode.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputHardTolerance
member.summary: How many frames the server will wait until it expires a frame and replaces all non-received inputs with repeated inputs or 's and sends it out to all players.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputRedundancy
member.summary: How much staggering the Quantum client should apply to redundant input resends. 1 = Wait one frame, 2 = Wait two frames, etc.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputRepeatMaxDistance
member.summary: How many frames Quantum will scan for repeatable inputs. 5 = Scan five frames forward and backwards, 10 = Scan ten frames, etc.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.SessionStartTimeout
member.summary: How long the server will wait to commence the start request that was requested by the first client. This is supposed to give other clients a bit breathing room to join the room. Usually set to 0 or 1. Defined in seconds. Default is 1.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.TimeCorrectionRate
member.summary: How many times per second the server will send out time correction packages to make sure every clients time is synchronized.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.MinTimeCorrectionFrames
member.summary: How much the local client time must differ with the server time when a time correction package is received for the client to adjust it's local clock. Defined in frames.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.MinOffsetCorrectionDiff
member.summary: How many frames the current local input delay must diff to the current requested offset for Quantum to update the local input offset. Defined in frames.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.TimeScaleMin
member.summary: The smallest timescale that can be applied by the server. Defined in percent.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.TimeScalePingMin
member.summary: The ping value that the server will start lowering the time scale towards 'Time Scale Minimum'. Defined in milliseconds.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.TimeScalePingMax
member.summary: The ping value that the server will reach the 'Time Scale Minimum' value at, i.e. be at its slowest setting. Defined in milliseconds.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputDelayMin
member.summary: The minimum input offset a player can have. Defined in ticks.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputDelayMax
member.summary: The maximum input offset a player can have. Defined in ticks.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputDelayPingStart
member.summary: At what ping value that Quantum starts applying input offset. Defined in milliseconds.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicSessionConfig.InputFixedSize
member.summary: Fixed input size.

member.summary: Converts a DeterministicSessionConfig instance to a byte array.
member.returns: A byte array representing the serialized DeterministicSessionConfig instance.

member.summary: Converts a byte array to a DeterministicSessionConfig instance.

member.name: T:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicInputFlags
member.summary: The DeterministicInputFlags are used by Quantum to: - detect whether a player is present , i.e.connected, to the simulation; - decide how to predict the next tick's input for a given player; and, - know whether the input on a verified frame was provided by a client or was replaced by the server.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicInputFlags.Repeatable
member.summary: Tells both the server and other clients to copy this input data into the next tick (on server when replacing input due to timeout, and on other clients for the local prediction algorithm). This can be set by the developer from Unity when injecting player input and should be used on direct-control-like input such as movement. It is not meant for command-like input (e.g. buy item).

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicInputFlags.PlayerNotPresent
member.summary: No client connected for this player index.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicInputFlags.ReplacedByServer
member.summary: The player index is controlled by a client, but the client did not send the input in time which resulted in the server repeating or replacing/zeroing out the input.

member.name: F:Photon.Deterministic.DeterministicInputFlags.Command
member.summary: This input has an additional deterministic command.

member.summary: Gets the number of bytes required to represent the current position of the stream pointer in the .

member.name: P:Photon.Deterministic.BitStream.IsEvenBytes
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the position of the stream pointer in the is aligned on even bytes.
member.remarks: The position of the stream pointer is considered to be aligned on even bytes if the remainder of division by 8 is 0. For example, if the value is 16, it is aligned on even bytes, but if the value is 17, it is not aligned on even bytes.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.BitStream.SerializeArrayLength``1(``0[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Serializes or deserializes the length of a generic array.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the array.
member.param: The array to serialize or deserialize.
The max size of the input array as a safety mechanism to limit the buffers allocated on deserializing commands for example.
member.returns: The length of the array secured by maxLength.

member.name: M:Photon.Deterministic.BitStream.SerializeArray``1(``0[]@,Photon.Deterministic.BitStream.ArrayElementSerializer{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Serializes or deserializes an array using a custom serializer.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the array.
member.param: The array to serialize or deserialize.
The custom serializer for the array elements.
The max size of the input array as a safety mechanism to limit the buffers allocated on deserializing commands for example.
member.remarks: If write mode is enabled, the method serializes the length of the array, followed by each element of the array using the provided serializer. If write mode is disabled, the method deserializes the length of the array, creates a new array of the appropriate length, and populates the new array by deserializing each array element using the provided serializer.

member.name: T:Quantum.PlayerRef
member.summary:
Represents a Quantum player.
The PlayerRef, in contrast to the player index, is 1-based. The reason is that default(PlayerRef) will return a "null/invalid" player ref struct for convenience. There are automatic cast operators that can cast an int into a PlayerRef.
member.example: default(PlayerRef), internally a 0, means NOBODY PlayerRef, internally 1, is the same as player index 0 PlayerRef, internally 2, is the same as player index 1

member.name: F:Quantum.PlayerRef.SIZE
member.summary: The size of the struct in-memory inside the Frame data-buffers or stack (when passed as value parameter). Not related to the snapshot payload this occupies, which is bit-packed and compressed.

member.name: F:Quantum.PlayerRef._index
member.summary: PlayerRef backing field. 0 means no player.

member.name: P:Quantum.PlayerRef.None
member.summary: None player has index 0.

member.name: P:Quantum.PlayerRef.IsValid
member.summary: Returns if the player reference is valid (larger than 0).

member.summary: Returns if the PlayerRefs are equal.
